title: Ski bums, rejoice: Killington was the first ski mountain to open in North America
text: By Charlotte Wilder @TheWilderThings Boston.com Staff | 10.20.15 | 8:10 PM Some New Englanders are still thawing out from last winter and can’t imagine crawling through those dark, snow-filled months again. But others are raring to go, dusting off their skis and boots and making sure their snow pants still fit. If you’re in the latter camp, we’ve got great news for you: The Burlington Free Press reports that Killington Mountain in Vermont just started sending people down the mountain on Sunday, making it the first ski slope in North America to open for the season (Sunday River opened Monday ). The mountain currently has about 600 vertical feet of runs available, accessible by two open chairlifts. And while it’s snowed about an inch up at Killington so far, Mother Nature isn’t on her own, here. The mountain’s snowmaking machines mean that you’ll have a decent base on which to shred.
